# _The Baby and the Battleship_

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Jump to: navigation, search

The Baby and the Battleship  
---  
Directed by | [Jay Lewis](/wiki/Jay_Lewis "Jay Lewis")  
Starring | [John Mills](/wiki/John_Mills "John Mills")  
Music by | [Humphrey Searle](/wiki/Humphrey_Searle "Humphrey Searle")  
Distributed by | [British Lion Films](/wiki/British_Lion_Films "British Lion Films")  
[Distributors Corporation of
America](/wiki/Distributors_Corporation_of_America "Distributors Corporation
of America") (US)  
Release date | 1956  
Country | [United Kingdom](/wiki/United_Kingdom "United Kingdom")  
Language | [English](/wiki/English_language "English language")  
Box office | £258,845 (UK)[1]  
  
_**The Baby and the Battleship**_ is a colour 1956
[British](/wiki/Cinema_of_the_United_Kingdom "Cinema of the United Kingdom")
[comedy film](/wiki/Comedy_film "Comedy film") directed by [Jay
Lewis](/wiki/Jay_Lewis "Jay Lewis") and starring [John Mills](/wiki/John_Mills
"John Mills"), [Richard Attenborough](/wiki/Richard_Attenborough "Richard
Attenborough") and [André Morell](/wiki/Andr%C3%A9_Morell "André Morell").[2]
It is based on the 1956 novel by Anthony Thorne with a screenplay by Richard
De Roy, [Gilbert Hackforth-Jones](/wiki/Gilbert_Hackforth-Jones "Gilbert
Hackforth-Jones") and [Bryan Forbes](/wiki/Bryan_Forbes "Bryan Forbes"). The
[Royal Navy](/wiki/Royal_Navy "Royal Navy") provided a large amount of
cooperation with sequences filmed aboard [HMS
_Birmingham_](/wiki/HMS_Birmingham_\(C19\) "HMS Birmingham \(C19\)") and in
[Malta](/wiki/Malta "Malta").

## Contents

[hide]

  * 1 Plot
  * 2 Cast
  * 3 Reception
  * 4 References
  * 5 External links

##
Plot[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Baby_and_the_Battleship&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Plot")]

When a group of [Royal Navy](/wiki/Royal_Navy "Royal Navy") sailors go ashore
on [shore leave](/wiki/Shore_leave "Shore leave") to [Naples](/wiki/Naples
"Naples"), they are forced to care for a baby, separated from its mother.[3]
During a brawl, Puncher Roberts is knocked unconscious and finds the square
empty, except for the baby. Unable to find his friend Knocker, or the child's
mother, he smuggles the baby aboard their ship in the midst of a series of
joint operations with Allied navies off the coast of [Italy](/wiki/Italy
"Italy").

##
Cast[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Baby_and_the_Battleship&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: Cast")]

  * [John Mills](/wiki/John_Mills "John Mills") \- Puncher Roberts
  * [Richard Attenborough](/wiki/Richard_Attenborough "Richard Attenborough") \- Knocker White
  * [André Morell](/wiki/Andr%C3%A9_Morell "André Morell") \- Marshal
  * [Bryan Forbes](/wiki/Bryan_Forbes "Bryan Forbes") \- Professor Evans
  * [Michael Hordern](/wiki/Michael_Hordern "Michael Hordern") \- Captain Hugh
  * [Ernest Clark](/wiki/Ernest_Clark "Ernest Clark") \- Commander Geoffrey Digby
  * [Harry Locke](/wiki/Harry_Locke "Harry Locke") \- Chief Petty Officer Blades
  * [Michael Howard](/wiki/Michael_Howard_\(comedian\) "Michael Howard \(comedian\)") \- Joe
  * [Lionel Jeffries](/wiki/Lionel_Jeffries "Lionel Jeffries") \- George
  * [Clifford Mollison](/wiki/Clifford_Mollison "Clifford Mollison") \- Sails
  * [Thorley Walters](/wiki/Thorley_Walters "Thorley Walters") \- Lieutenant Setley
  * [Duncan Lamont](/wiki/Duncan_Lamont "Duncan Lamont") \- Master-at-Arms
  * [Lisa Gastoni](/wiki/Lisa_Gastoni "Lisa Gastoni") \- Maria
  * [Cyril Raymond](/wiki/Cyril_Raymond "Cyril Raymond") \- PMO
  * [Harold Siddons](/wiki/Harold_Siddons "Harold Siddons") \- Whiskers
  * [D. A. Clarke-Smith](/wiki/D._A._Clarke-Smith "D. A. Clarke-Smith") \- The Admiral
  * [Kenneth Griffith](/wiki/Kenneth_Griffith "Kenneth Griffith") \- Sub-Lieutenant
  * [John Le Mesurier](/wiki/John_Le_Mesurier "John Le Mesurier") \- The Marshal's Aide
  * [Carlo Giustini](/wiki/Carlo_Giustini "Carlo Giustini") \- Carlo Vespucci
  * [Ferdy Mayne](/wiki/Ferdy_Mayne "Ferdy Mayne") \- Interpreter
  * Vincent Barbi - Second Brother
  * [Gordon Jackson](/wiki/Gordon_Jackson_\(actor\) "Gordon Jackson \(actor\)") \- Harry
  * Vittorio Vittori - Third Brother
  * Martyn Garrett - The Baby
  * [Barry Foster](/wiki/Barry_Foster_\(actor\) "Barry Foster \(actor\)") \- Sailor at Dance
  * [Robert Ayres](/wiki/Robert_Ayres_\(actor\) "Robert Ayres \(actor\)") \- American Captain

##
Reception[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Baby_and_the_Battleship&action=edit&section=3
"Edit section: Reception")]

The film was one of the ten most popular movies at the British box office in
1956.[4]

##
